Articles.Content: Hi I recently accepted a contract which says I should test the MK16 parachute in flight at a height of 1400/2400 and a speed of 500/1000 m / s which is impossible because at that point and at that speed the parachute always It is in "unsafe" or "risk" for which no unfolds and ends up not fulfilled the contract. If within that altitude parachute opens but at a speed of 130 m / s which as you will see is not enough. I think this is almost impossible to do contract. If someone has done Tell me please as they have done since I do not see the light at the issue. Of course gracias.-
I believe if you right click you should be able to " test" if not, adjust the Minn atmosphere up to around .65-.70 to allow you to stage without it deploying until in deeper atmosphere.
I've done all that my friend and i do not abut the way I think I'll have to give up the contract.
Some of these contracts have not been corrected for 1.0.4. You just have to use common sense as you have figured out here. Not all contracts can be be accomplished.

Nonsense, that contract is perfectly doable! The scientists want to find out how big of a bang the parachute makes, that's all - nobody ever said the parachute had to SURVIVE it. Or that you had to open the parachute on the way DOWN.
Don't use the test chute for landing. Have a couple of radial chutes on to bring the ship down safely after you've performed the destructive test on the Mk 16. Make sure they're in a separate stage.

Easy on a plane. Pack a second chute for survival if you want. Rocket might be hard to get to that speed at that altitude.

While contracts are not good, they are still not impossible - even like sun-suborbital or Sun part testing with just thousands of altitude range over billions of meters of orbit height, they aren't hard once you know how to do it.

Well, probably except for that 2-year Pluto satellite contract, but that's with RO/RSS, not stock.
